alert.note: Alert for Cascades in Lane County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 21 at 4:15AM PDT until October 22 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 11 PM PDT SATURDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Cascades in Lane County above 4000 feet. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 11 PM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Willamette Pass along Highway 58 will likely be impacted by snow covered roads, especially early Saturday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest accumulations will be above the Cascade passes. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit https://www.tripcheck.com
